definition: all one's hopes and efforts come to nothing/futile
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
variant of 場|场[chang2]
variant of 場|场[chang3]
empty/air/sky/in vain
to empty/vacant/unoccupied/space/leisure/free time
using a wicker basket to draw water (idiom); wasted effort
pinyin: zhu2 lan2 da3 shui3 , yi1 chang2 kong1

sentences.english: His dream of being hired as an editor proved to be pie in the sky.
sentences.chinese: 他当编辑的梦想证明不过是竹篮打水一场空。

sentences.english: "play boxing without internal, you will get nothing".
After months of struggling it had clearly gotten to be a futile exercise.
sentences.chinese: 好几个月的斗争换来的却是竹篮打水一场空。

sentences.english: Two of her girls had been on the point of marriage, and after all there was nothing in it.
sentences.chinese: 两个女儿本来快要出嫁了，到头来只落得一场空。

sentences.english: You are drawing water with a sieve.
Finally, it is like drawing water with a sieve.
sentences.chinese: 到头来，竹篮打水一场空。

sentences.english: It means that all the wealth in the world is nothing but a dream.
sentences.chinese: “南柯一梦”比喻世间荣华富贵不过是一场空梦。

sentences.english: Sikorski died in a plane crash in Gibraltar a year later.
sentences.chinese: 一年以后，希科尔斯基在直布罗陀的一场空难中遇害。

sentences.english: Fucked with a Deadfish , I Realized that i was Confussed.
sentences.chinese: 明知道这只是一场空，还要不断地麻醉自己。

definition: using a wicker basket to draw water (idiom); wasted effort
in the end/finally/as a result
see 黃粱夢|黄粱梦[huang2 liang2 meng4]
lit. flowers in a mirror and the moon reflected in the lake (idiom)/fig. an unrealistic rosy view/viewing things through rose-tinted spectacles/also written 水月鏡花|水月镜花
the chicken has flown the coop and the eggs are broken/a dead loss (idiom)
lit. a dream of Nanke/fig. dreams of grandeur
lit. froth and shadows/fig. illusion/mirage
to work to no avail (idiom)
to commit to the waters (idiom); to lose sth irrevocably
loss of life and property/to lose the beauty and her possessions
lit. to scoop the moon out of the water (idiom)/a hopeless endeavor
dream of golden millet/fig. illusions of wealth and power/pipe dream
ending up as/leading to/resulting in/in total
things turn out contrary to the way one wishes (idiom)
lit. the falling flowers are yearning for love, but the heartless brook ripples on (idiom)/fig. one side is willing, yet the other one remains indifferent (usually of unrequited love)
pinyin: luo4 hua1 you3 yi4 , liu2 shui3 wu2 qing2

definition: futile endeavor (idiom)
